{{also|Heute}} ==German== ===Alternative forms=== * {{l|de|heut}} (colloquial or poetic) * {{l|de|heut'}} ===Etymology=== From {{inh|de|goh|hiutu}}, a contraction of earlier {{m|goh|*[[hiu]] [[tagu]]}}, a [[relict]] [[instrumental]] case form meaning “on this day”. Compare for the contraction {{cog|osx|hiudigu}} and younger {{m|osx|hiudu}}. Similar formations, but with different stems, are {{cog|la|hodie}} and {{cog|grc|σήμερον}}. ===Pronunciation=== * {{IPA|de|/ˈhɔʏ̯tə/}} * {{audio|de|De-heute.ogg|audio (Germany)}} * {{audio|de|De-at-heute.ogg|audio (Austria)}} * {{homophones|de|häute|Häute}} ===Adverb=== {{de-adv}} # [[today]] ====Usage notes==== * Often used also where English would use {{m|en||tonight}}. {{m|de|heute früh}}, {{m|de|heute morgen}}, {{m|de|heute abend}}, {{m|de|heute nacht}}, or {{m|de|heute Morgen}}, {{m|de|heute Abend}}, {{m|de|heute Nacht}}, etc., are used chiefly when there is a need to specify (like English “this morning”, “this afternoon”, etc.). ====Derived terms==== * {{l|de|heutig}} * {{l|de|heutzutage}} ====See also==== {| class="wikitable" |- ! -3 !! -2 !! -1 !! today !! +1 !! +2 !! +3 |- | {{l|de|[[vor]] [[drei]] [[Tagen]]}},
